KLOOQUE: No, no, my dear. I’m quite well.
Don’tJ Don’t!
PIPETTE: You’re joking, I suppose?
KLOOQUE: Quite so. Joking. Don’t.
WITCH: He’s showing you how he fought the
enemy.

KLOOQUE: No, my dear! I’m showing you how the
enemy fought us. This is the way they
retreated. Don’t, don’t!
HE BACKS OFF, DUCKING /
PIPETTE: What a very strange man.
WITCH: He’s a very rude man.
PIPETTE: Rude?
WITCH: Yes. (LOOKING AFTER HIM INDIGNANTIY)
He put his arm around my waist. s Vo

V - WITCH: (TURNING TO PIPETTE) Well, my dear,
what do you want?
PIPETTE: I want to ask you a great, great favor.
WITCH: Yes?
PIPETTE: You’re such a dear old lady I’m sure
you’ll grant it.
WITCH:
I am a pleasant old person,
